item.title: Danganronpa 2x2 Hides a Major Twist Right Under Fansâ€™ Noses
item.description:
Danganronpa 2x2 is probably the last thing that fans expected from a new Danganronpa game. While the chances of the Danganronpa franchise being brought back already seemed slim enough, due to the ending of Danganronpa V3 , this title is particularly unusual, even by the series' standards. Revealed last week during Nintendo's latest Direct, Danganronpa 2x2 is a remake of Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair and a brand-new entry in the series at the same time. Not only does it contain a revamped version of the original game with modernized visuals, it also includes an alternate story route that features an entirely new set of killers and victims involving the same cast of characters.

Since it's effectively just a visual novel, one might think that a Danganronpa 2 remake wouldn't look that different from its predecessor. In Danganronpa 2x2 's case, however, the game's graphics seem to be greatly improved compared to the previous Danganronpa games. All the sprites, UIs, and artwork in Danganronpa 2x2 have been completely remade from the ground up, and the voice lines in the game have been re-recorded, as well. While Spike Chunsoft, the publisher of Danganronpa 2x2 , has shared a lot of information about the remake portion of the game, it's provided comparatively few details about its new storyline. That being said, one of the game's biggest plot twists may be hiding in plain sight.

Although Danganronpa 2x2 is primarily being made by Gemdrops, the studio behind the Star Ocean: Second Story R remake, series creator Kazutaka Kodaka and his company, Too Kyo Games, are involved in the game's development.

Danganronpa 2x2's Name May Be Hiding a Major Secret

Perhaps the strangest thing about Danganronpa 2x2 , aside from the fact that it's basically two games in one, is its name. Spike Chunsoft producer Sakakibara Shouhei confirmed in a recent interview with Famitsu that the official pronunciation of Danganronpa 2x2 's name is "Danganronpa Two by Two". Now, to the average gamer, this may not seem like an important detail, but, as anyone who's played Danganronpa V3 can attest, this naming convention will probably have major implications on the narrative of the game.

The following contains major spoilers for the endings of Danganronpa 2 and Danganronpa V3 .

The V in Danganronpa V3 Stands for 50 Rather than Volume

During the notoriously controversial ending of Danganronpa V3 , it is revealed that the entirety of the Danganronpa series' events are completely fake, and that the Danganronpa franchise is a fictional reality TV show in the game's world. Contrary to early speculation, it turns out that the V in Danganronpa V3 's name doesn't actually stand for "volume". Rather, it refers to the Roman number V, which means five. Danganronpa V3 isn't the third installment in the series, as fans were initially led to believe, but it is instead the 53rd season of the Danganronpa TV show in-game.

Since 2 Times 2 Equals 4, Danganronpa 2x2 May Actually Be Danganronpa 4 in Disguise

Given that Danganronpa 2x2 's name doesn't follow any standard naming conventions, it's possible that it is also hiding some deeper narrative meaning, just like in Danganronpa V3 . Two times two, of course, equals four, so maybe this game is somehow Danganronpa 4 in disguise. For starters, Danganronpa 2 takes place in a virtual reality simulator called the Neo World Program. Since all the murders in the game technically don't happen in the real world, Danganronpa 2 's cast of characters can easily be revived and killed again without suffering any significant narrative consequences.

Danganronpa 2x2 Could Be a Remake, a Sequel, and a Reboot All at the Same Time

Plot conveniences aside, it's worth noting that Danganronpa 2x2 is intended to serve as a sort of reboot for the overarching Danganronpa franchise, while also acting as a remake and potentially a sequel. In the aforementioned Famitsu interview, Sakakibara Shouhei stated that all the Danganronpa franchise's major plot points from stories set before Danganronpa 2 are still canonical to 2x2 .

The events that take place after it, however, such as the stories of Danganronpa V3 and the Danganronpa 3 anime, may or may not be canon in the game. If Danganronpa 2x2 is more or less meant to be a fresh start for the franchise, it wouldn't be that surprising if Spike Chunsoft decided to pull a bait-and-switch on fans again and secretly make it the series' fourth mainline installment.

Danganronpa 2x2

item.title: Silksong: How to Unlock Cross Stitch Ability (Parry)
item.description:
Hollow Knight: Silksong's combat is simple in nature, but players can add variety to it by using various skills in combination with normal attacks. You can pull off a deflect, a somewhat advanced combat maneuver, that cancels out an incoming attack with Hornet's needle. However, later on in the game, players will be able to unlock the Cross Stitch ability. When activated at the right time, this skill will allow Hornet to parry an incoming attack and launch a powerful counterattack in return. Here's how to unlock it.

How to Get Cross Stitch Ability in Silksong (Parry & Counterattack Skill)

Players can unlock the Cross Stitch (parry and counterattack) ability by defeating the Phantom Boss located inside the Exhaust Organ in Silksong . Exhaust Organ is one of the mid-game areas that players will be making their way through when traveling to the Citadel to begin Act Two.

So, players must start their journey in Greymoor and reach the Sinner's Road through the entrance in the top-right corner of the area. Make your way through the muckroach-infested swamps of Sinner's Road and reach the top-left section of the area. The path will lead you directly into an area called The Mist.

The Mist is a rather special area in Silksong that doesn't have a map, and players cannot normally navigate it either, since they'll be stuck in a loop. The only way to get through The Mist area is by finding a group of fireflies (white glowing insects) and playing the Needolin close to them. The fireflies will flutter away in the distance, and you'll have to follow them to a nearby exit.

Players will need to repeat this for a couple of more sections to finally exit The Mist and reach the entrance to the Exhaust Organ area . It's a largely open space with a small entryway leading to the bowels of the Exhaust Organ.

After entering the Exhaust Organ area, you'll need to do a bit of platforming to reach the upper sections and encounter the boss. So, move forward through the starting area and carefully make your way up the steaming exhausts.

Once you reach the top of the area, you'll enter the boss room where the encounter with the Phantom will begin . Phantom has a small frame and an agile body, which makes her harder to target and hit. Players will need to carefully dodge her swift strikes and attack when they see an opening to quickly dispatch the Phantom.

Once you defeat the Phantom, a cool cutscene will play out where you'll need to press the action button to parry the Phantom's attack and land a lethal blow. Once the boss fight is over, players will immediately unlock the Cross Stitch ability in Silksong .

It's one of the best abilities for players who play the game a little defensively and love the parry mechanic in other games.

Defeating Phantom will also show up the Exhaust Organ area on your map. However, you'll need the maps for Sinner's Road and Bilewater for it to show up.

38
9.2 /10

Hollow Knight: Silksong

item.title: Skate Players Are Running Into Server Issues
item.description:
Gamers are reporting that they're having server and connection problems with Skate . Unfortunately, these issues are landing on Skate 's early access release date, frustrating and discouraging players who have been eagerly awaiting the game.

After fifteen years with no new entries in the franchise, and five years since the game was initially announced, players have been extremely excited for the release of EA's Skate . Unlike the series' prior games, Skate is free to play, which has no doubt led to a lot of players checking it out right away. Unfortunately, it seems like EA may have underestimated the excitement the audience had for the game.

EA's Skate Has Launch Day Server Issues

Skate launched in Early Access on September 16, and almost immediately, players started reporting connection and server issues while trying to play the game. So far, gamers have complained about extremely long queues, with screenshots being shared of players waiting with over 25,000 others supposedly in front of them. Another player said that they were put into the queue with over 50,000 players ahead of them. The wait has gone on for so long for some fans that they've openly expressed that they're giving up for the day, and are hoping things improve after the initial crowds die down.

Even those who have managed to download Skate and get past the queue, however, haven't had a smooth experience. Many players have complained that they've been hit with connection errors that have sent them right back to the queue, while others have dealt with infinite loading screens after completing the tutorial. Another gamer noted that after waiting in the queue until it was their turn, the game then claimed they had no internet access, and put them into an even longer queue.

Numerous players have taken the opportunity to call out problems with online-only games, especially given prior entries were available to play offline. It's not uncommon for highly-anticipated games to see a long queue in the early days, but as some would-be players have said that they aren't interested in the online features at all, it makes these connection issues even more frustrating. Thankfully, players should see some improvement soon. The Skate development team quickly became aware of the demand for the game, and indicated that they are adding more servers to improve queue wait times. As of publication time, it looks like more players are having success getting in and trying out the game, but some players are still experiencing problems maintaining a connection.

skate.

item.title: Xbox Launches Buy 1 Get 2 Free Sale for September 2025
item.description:
Xbox recently began a new Buy 1, Get 2 Free sale for September 2025 that includes tons of different indie titles. With popular cult classics like Choo-Choo Charles included in this sale, Xbox gamers can use this deal to pick up a curated collection of indie games at an affordable price.

If there is one thing Xbox gamers have no shortage of, it is ways to pick up new games without spending too much money. Between gaining access to tons of games through Xbox Game Pass and myriad sales, there are often ways to bulk up oneâ€™s backlog without breaking the bank.

Xbox Buy 1, Get 2 Free Indie Game Sale (September 2025)

Now, Microsoft has begun yet another promotion that fans of indie games wonâ€™t want to miss out on. From now until September 23, players can partake in a new Buy 1, Get 2 Free deal on Xbox to purchase three games for the price of one. This time, the list consists primarily of indie titles, including fan-favorites like Choo-Choo Charles , The Walking Dead: A New Frontier , and Bugsnax , along with tons of other small-studio games that would be strong additions to any collection.

To find these deals, one needs only boot up their Xbox console of choice and navigate to the â€œDealsâ€ section, where they will find the â€œBuy 1, Get 2 Freeâ€ section. From there, simply select the three games and check out as normal. Keep in mind that the most expensive game will be the one players will have to purchase, with the other two of equal or lesser value obtained at no extra cost.

This isnâ€™t the first time Xbox has done a Buy 1, Get 2 Free sale â€“ but it may be one of the most affordable ones. For example, the Xbox BOGT sale from February contained several AAA games like Hogwarts Legacy , but only in their expensive digital deluxe editions. While frugal gamers could pick from the sparse list of cheap games, this new sale contains dozens of inexpensive indie titles, with few even reaching the $30 mark.

Of note, some of the games included in this deal are also available for free via the Xbox Game Pass. While fans could technically add these games to their libraries permanently, they may want to avoid these titles in favor of ones they otherwise might not have the ability to play for free through other means.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Zombies Reveals Playable Characters and Story Details
item.description:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 shared the first trailer for the Zombies mode, showing characters and a bit of the story. Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 is set to be released on November 14, and one of the reasons why the game is highly anticipated by fans is the return of the ever-popular Zombies mode.

Fans first played the Zombies mode in 2008 with the release of Call of Duty: World at War , which introduced the terrifying undead and features such as the round system and perks. However, it was with the release of the first Black Ops in 2010 that Zombies would explode to become what it is today. It would also introduce Nacht der Untoten, considered one of the best Black Ops Zombies maps. The Zombies mode has been one of the most popular aspects of the Call of Duty series for over 10 years. Now, players know a little more about what to expect from it in Black Ops 7 .

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Presents First Action-Packed Zombies Trailer

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 has shared the first Zombies trailer. Grigori Weaver, Elizabeth Grey, Mac Carver, and Maya Aguinaldo, the Zombies characters from Black Ops 6 , appear at Janus Towers along with more people. The crew's celebration is interrupted, and they are all sent to the Aether Dimension, where they meet a man with a scary appearance wearing a cowboy hat and sunglasses, and carrying skulls in cages. The man uses the skulls to suck the souls out of the characters and disappears through a portal, leaving them to fight the zombies.

For the release of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 , Treyarch has expanded the Zombies team with more characters. They will be Takeo Masaki, a ronin from Feudal Japan with no master, a new version of Tank Dempsey, now a US Marine who fought in Vietnam, Soviet tank commander Nikolai Belinksi, and Edward Richtofen, a doctor and hero of the Reich. Beyond that, some mysteries still surround the Zombies mode, such as the identity of the new villain.

Black Ops 7 Zombies Characters

  • Grigori Weaver
  • Elizabeth Grey
  • Mac Carver
  • Maya Aguinaldo
  • Takeo Masaki
  • Tank Dempsey
  • Nikolai Belinksi
  • Edward Richtofen

While Call of Duty fans have several questions after the reveal of the new cinematic trailer, they will be answered soon. Next week, the developers promise to share â€œa massive intel blastâ€ about Black Ops 7 's Zombies mode, including extensive gameplay, enemies, systems, and content. The reveal will come in anticipation of the upcoming official Call of Duty event on September 30, which promises to offer more info about the multiplayer to fans.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7

In Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, Treyarch and Raven Software are bringing players the most mind-bending Black Ops ever. The year is 2035 and the world is on the brink of chaos, ravaged by violent conflict and psychological warfare following the events of the fan-favorite titles Black Ops 2 and Black Ops 6. Wielding cutting-edge technology, the Black Ops team led by David Mason must fight back against a manipulative enemy who weaponizes fear above all else.

Squad up with friends or play solo in a thrilling and innovative Co-op Campaign, harness near-future weaponry in a signature Multiplayer experience packed with brand-new maps, and descend into the next twisted chapter of Round-Based Zombies in the heart of the Dark Aether.
